document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards – Extended English Language Proficiency

FF45CCB5BD1343B295DE35C3C2BBDDD5.description:
identify the meaning of words by
indicating a picture related to the word.

349E0F54A1574A0AA874D689D4AFE090.description:
given a sentence with a preposition,
choose the appropriate picture, for
example: “The book is on the table,” or
“The book is under the table.”

2C3DBBE156464C8FA3BB962C82E96D8F.description:
indicates the correct one of two
pictures: one is of man walking, another
has a man swimming. The student is
asked, “Which man is walking?”

3C5481DFD394475B8C7C12FC2C88CA39.description:
identify the meaning of words by
pointing to or giving teacher a picture
related to the word.

8C91287775754AB8B76D025A93BD3D01.description:
recognize and use a small number of
frequently occurring nouns, pronouns,
verbs, prepositions, adjectives, adverbs
and conjunctions produce simple
sentences on a familiar topic.

7BC440D115074A818196276FD67163A9.description:
produce simple and compound
sentences and a few complex
sentences on familiar topics.

3B1B28928EF6411ABBD80FFA600F1AD1.description:
recognize and use an increasing
number of frequently occurring nouns,
pronouns, verbs, prepositions,
adjectives, adverbs and conjunctions.

1A860E6011964A3DA137C54F51D8F948.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
make accurate use of standard
English to communicate in grade-appropriate speech and writing.

D734399E4240498D988726172D76E6DD.description:
use a narrow range of frequently
occurring vocabulary and simple
sentences with limited control.

079F19B68DFF4A95BE435B088A7A87A8.description:
communicate simple information about
an event or familiar topic.

E735DBDD4F3C45C59E6E03ECA84CDC50.description:
use some frequently occurring linking
words with emerging control.

34CDE28949E346ABB8B940D80DA5015F.description:
communicate simple information about
an event or familiar topic.

AB0BF89402CA468092C57968750A9DAA.description:
use an increasing range of temporal
words and linking words and some
transitional words and phrases with
increasing control.

059BEF4AB2124045ACFAB1B45235DC49.description: retell a short sequence of events.

CE432EB46F2B4DFB84BD438CAEA0B4F2.description:
communicate a few pieces of
information about a familiar topic.

79B4135D802F4D63A16BFC2E06A96B1F.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
create clear and coherent grade-appropriate speech and text.

66C959A51CE5402CA58F44EAF74A4D78.description:
recognize the meaning of a few
frequently occurring words, phrases
and expressions in simple oral
discourse, read-alouds and simple
written texts about familiar topics,
experiences or events.

B591326A3D1B4E54902DF83EB9F611AC.description:
With prompting and support and relying
heavily on context, visual aids and
communicative experience:

B246A87006A34D65BA840500A041B407.description:
determine the meaning of some
frequently occurring words, phrases
and expressions in simple oral
discourse, read-alouds and simple
written texts about familiar topics,
experiences or events.

54BFD033FD5641A6B3FC22E8BD6A33AE.description:
With prompting and support and relying
some on context, visual aids, reference
materials and communicative experience:

65EE20D772FA4D8E8DB69CC40E5C8F40.description:
determine the meaning of frequently
occurring words and phrases, general
academic and content-specific words
and an increasing number of
expressions in texts about familiar
topics, experiences or events.

8F144DADA4364C49BAD22398C5C5E121.description:
With prompting and support and using
context, visual aids, reference materials, and
knowledge of English:

4CD17501927943E2841229EC7FE08C8A.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
determine the meaning of words
and phrases in oral presentations
and literary and informational text.

DC0E2CBA8E2A48DD83DBC7225E8243DA.description:
recognize the meaning of some words
learned through conversations, reading
and being read to.

786D033B88DC433B90CE900F239BA2F1.description:
With prompting and support and showing
increasing control:

501D3A804AC3437FBB850C94B81EA4D5.description:
use some learned words, sounds,
expressions and gestures appropriate
for social and academic contexts (e.g.,
playground, classroom) showing
developing control.

BFF297F825734B8FA838FF6035A3BAEA.description:
With prompting and support and showing
increasing control:

3ED4F37EDAD941FF8A8F84CC0F9DD756.description:
use an increasing number of learned
words, sounds, expressions and
gestures appropriate for social and
academic contexts (e.g., playground,
classroom) showing increasing control
in speech and writing.

72430A616E0F41408077A9ABF4A9882B.description:
With prompting and support and showing
increasing control:

E607321362E94F328984DFA55F7496EA.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
adapt language choices to
purpose, task, and audience when
speaking and writing.

7EB56E7D9A7B4299B45178B35A472AAC.description:
identify a point an author or speaker
makes.

60CAF5505AA14E14B7CE1269A76C617D.description:
agree or disagree with the author or
speaker.

D392169D4C814CDD96F0525C8CA41F61.description:
identify a reason an author or speaker
gives to support a main idea.

5F84DA1224E34298AF8B22604A03841C.description:
tell how one or two reasons support the
specific points an author or a speaker
makes on a familiar topic.

59D2BCC5A59B4B39A0BAAC0530F2CA96.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
analyze and critique the arguments
of others orally and in writing.

D67BAEE52C6246E78B60780EE8FA6747.description:
participate in shared research projects
label information from provided
sources.

CA4349821E7B4814A8DDC112858D7221.description:
recall information from experience
record some information from provided
sources.

CFB088CC3A66408B8B07FE64F797A6BA.description:
retell key ideas and information from
provided sources.

8C521AE7D5E94FD8A34F342386F7923C.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
conduct research, evaluate, and
communicate findings to answer
questions or solve problems.

DB2ED914AFE748F099825131C50F843C.description:
express an opinion about a familiar
topic.

EA94DE6FF5204BF09EDCE03293BEB830.description:
provide one or two reasons or facts to
support the opinion

15311F945685485ABB901B60F277E05B.description:
provide a few reasons or facts to
support the opinion

90F17B82B86942A2AC06D02D79F30AF7.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct grade-appropriate oral
and written claims and support
them with reasoning and evidence.

853310B866734693A4C5CD0A01B01FC3.description:
communicate simple information about
familiar texts, topics, events or objects
in the environment.

8266EF91DE8449DB916A33DB797BFED2.description:
about familiar texts, topics, and
experiences.

921CD82E0A7D4172BCFF47CAD093E6E3.description:
about familiar texts, topics, and
experiences.

A141548CDC574386BBF19456EA7AF9D7.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
speak and write about grade-appropriate complex literary and
informational texts and topics.

C96900E7525C49BF9B3553C89318921F.description:
participate in short written exchanges
about familiar topics.

754BDEC0E21648BF94A85C2AE0217F4B.description:
respond to simple questions about
familiar topics and texts.

2D769085A62B4F25911A16EBE505555F.description:
respond to others’ comments or ideas
about familiar topics and texts.

163114F8055E4715BD7A12D0C5D9675E.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
participate in grade-appropriate oral
and written exchanges of
information, ideas, and analyses,
responding to peer, audience, or
reader comments and questions.

35B0EFED3AC84D82AE388A8C787AE700.description:
from read-alouds, simple written texts
and oral presentations.

4324677E5CE744F88549C88F0D86D80B.description: identify a few key words and phrases

129FFBF9D9A142DCB95A82CD186FC556.description:
With prompting and support, use a very
limited set of strategies to:

D98990B329FE4D0EA56EF31FCDB7EB86.description:
sequence information from readalouds, simple written texts and oral
presentations.

70B4CF211A25445DA8E673DC562EA4A9.description: identify the main topic or characters.

8D2250AE673A41ABB3DA0DF38A74ECFB.description:
With prompting and support, use an
emerging set of strategies to:

37D5BC748D0D493C9B32C73FD1BB275E.description:
retell parts of a story from read-alouds,
simple written texts and oral
presentations.

FDF334503258462E945A73D7A153170B.description:
identify some details that support the
main idea or theme.

4A7800592AB940DAA7456237CB2E83FC.description: determine the main idea or theme.

81A3120255FD4AF29649C01092DCF347.description:
With prompting and support, use an
increasing range of strategies to:

EAF313271DA94BDD95C7B868EA70FC58.description:
An English learner with
significant cognitive disabilities can
construct meaning from oral
presentations and literary and
informational text through grade-appropriate listening, reading, and
viewing.
